txt.en: 'I give you my thanks again [placeholder]. Your work has been excellent and revealed many problems for me. That being said, I may have work for you in the near future.'
Instance: The Storm Abated
Speak to Rothog the Storm and watch his reaction
With the ambush survived, Rothog enters into the room
Armed with proof of Shaidal's innocence, you approach Rothog the Storm with your findings.
'Rothog, you know for some time that I have professed my innocence for the time I have spent on the sands.'
'I must admit, Zarzíra Dawn-star's petition, was partially true.'
'I did employ someone to gain the information that has been passed to you.'
'However, I felt that you should know that it was not just talk, and I had to take this chance.'
'It should be clear that Zarzíra made it so that I was found guilty of murderous crimes. I was unjustly accused!'
Speak to Shaidal about his task.
Fight off the ambush awaiting you in Rothog's chambers.

'I am glad that I have an avenue to gain my freedom, but saddened that this treachery was not enough to gain it. I understand the ruling and will abide by it.\n\n'Ragrekhûl is known to be a dreaded beast, I only hope that I may be capable of capturing the beast.'
'I cannot believe that they would bring violence to my chambers.'
'Shaidal, I have read these books and records. What do you have to say for yourself?'
'Shaidal, the information that you have given me leads me to believe your tale.'
'I must look into it further.'
As you enter the room, various shadowed figures attack.
'However, I cannot allow for those who serve this place to do such things.'
'Your punishment for this transaction is to secure a fearsome beast from far away.'
'This creature is known as Ragrekhûl, and is very dangerous.'
'If you return the creature to me alive, I will commute your sentence for the previous crime.'
Speak to Shaidal about his task
Armed with proof of Shaidal's innocence, you approach Rothog the Storm with your findings.
'You will be given details. Now go.'
Defeat ambushers

'[placeholder], these rabble! How dare they invade my quarters?! There will be swift vengeance upon those who would do such a thing. I will have my guards take the bodies and feed them to the lions.\n\n'Anyway, you had mentioned that you managed to gather information that might be of interest to me?'
